chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon and because this is a domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor.

No illegal substances.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Defendant Quinton Sterling Peterson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 2 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/07/14.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No illegal substances.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon and because this is a domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

from the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 4 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Statements made by Gladys L.  The 6/23/14 jury trial is vacated.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, Domestic Abuse Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
